summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling resolution 1970 (2011) and subsequent resolutions on Libya, reaffirms its commitment to Libya's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity.

The Council calls on all parties to armed conflict to protect civilians, in line with international humanitarian, human rights, and refugee law.

It welcomes the efforts of the UN Support Mission in Libya (UNSMIL) and the Special Representative of the Secretary-General to facilitate a Libyan-led political solution.

The Council welcomes the Libyan Political Agreement signed on 17 December 2015, and recognizes the contribution of Member States, particularly the Kingdom of Morocco, in advancing the Agreement.

It encourages all parties in Libya to engage constructively with the Agreement in good faith.

The Council notes the need for assistance planning for a Government of National Accord and security arrangements.

It expresses concern at the grave humanitarian situation in Libya and encourages Member States to respond generously to the Libya Humanitarian Response Plan for 2016.

The Council welcomes efforts made by participants in the UN-facilitated Libyan Political Dialogue.

It urges the full, equal, and effective participation of women in all activities relating to democratic transition, conflict resolution, and peacebuilding.

The Council condemns terrorist acts in Libya by groups proclaiming allegiance to ISIL (Da'esh) and reiterates grave concern about their negative impact.

It reaffirms the need to combat terrorist acts, including those committed by groups proclaiming allegiance to ISIL in Libya.

The Council condemns engagement in direct or indirect trade with ISIL and other designated individuals, groups, and entities.

It expresses concern about the problem of smuggling oil products from Libya and calls on all Member States to cooperate with the Government of National Accord.

The Council reiterates its grave concern at the smuggling of migrants in the Mediterranean Sea and urges all Member States to cooperate with the Government of National Accord to tackle this issue.
